justification: "After the experience of each effort level, participants were given a child adapted NASA Task Load Index to report perceptions of the task."

measured_by: NASA Task Load Index mental-demand subscale
justification: "The NASA Task Load Index was used to measure perceived effort and mental demand of the task and scores were transformed to a scale of 1 to 10."

measured_by: discrepancy score based on 6-point self-performance rating
justification: "Participants rated on a 6-point scale how well they thought they had done… This allowed us to calculate a discrepancy score between actual performance and rated performance (Fleming & Lau, 2014)."

measured_by: percentage of low-effort choices in Demand Avoidance Choice task
justification: "The measure of interest was the percentage of trials in which participants chose the low-effort option. Choice behaviour from the demand avoidance paradigm reflects an implicit form of effort-based decision."

measured_by: stated preference in Demand Avoidance Preference Statement
justification: "After the 30 choices, participants were asked to state which of the two witches they preferred. The preference statement reflects a more explicit form of decision making."

measured_by: area under the curve from Effort Discounting Paradigm
justification: "Indifference values… were used to calculate a discounting function for which the area under the curve was computed for each participant… Larger values indicate greater degree of effort discounting."

topic_or_construct: task performance on attentional switch task
justification: "Task performance was computed as the overall percentage of trials … where individuals had at least one hit and no more than two false alarms (i.e. d' > 2)."
